partintro.para: There are various open source frameworks often used for implementation of web services including Apache CXF, Apache Axis/Axis2 and Spring Web Services. The cxf plugin is composed of reference libraries needed to use Apache CXF among them and CXF Service that provides a basic XmlAdapter class for Map type required to execute JAXB Databinding.
Install cxf plugin by entering the following command in the Command window.
The installation result can be checked using the installed (mvn anyframe:installed) or the jetty:run(mvn clean jetty:run) commands.

book.part:
Web Services
Anyframe provides the web service function using Apache CXF version 2.3.0.
Web services allow a number of existing application systems to interact through standardized technologies and enable all businesses through internet networks using those standardized technologies.
Web services provides wanted information and services anytime and anywhere and plays the role as a connection that overcomes the differences in communication between very flexible and heterogeneous operating systems and programs by defining the standards for exchanged data, not giving a perfect definition as other existing software does.
Web Service Architecture Working Group. W3C (Web Services Glossary and Web Services Architecture data search) defines Web Services as follows.
"A Web service is a software system designed to support interoperable machine-to-machine interaction over a network. It has an interface described in a machine-processable format (specifically WSDL). Other systems interact with the Web service in a manner prescribed by its description using SOAP-messages, typically conveyed using HTTP with an XML serialization in conjunction with other Web-related standards."
